sections.heading: The Legislature recognizes that there is a public need for independent and objective public accountants and that it is necessary to regulate the practice of public accounting to assure the minimum competence of practitioners and the accuracy of audit statements upon which the public relies and to pr
sections.text: The Legislature recognizes that there is a public need for independent and objective public accountants and that it is necessary to regulate the practice of public accounting to assure the minimum competence of practitioners and the accuracy of audit statements upon which the public relies and to protect the public from dishonest practitioners and, therefore, deems it necessary in the interest of public welfare to regulate the practice of public accountancy in this state.History.—ss. 1, 25, ch. 79-202; ss. 2, 3, ch. 81-318; ss. 10, 11, ch. 85-9; s. 4, ch. 91-429.

sections.heading: As used in this chapter, the term:(1)“Board” means the Board of Accountancy
sections.text: (2)“Department” means the Department of Business and Professional Regulation.(3)“Division” means the Division of Certified Public Accounting.(4)“Certified public accountant” means an individual who holds a license to practic

sections.heading: The board, by rule, may establish fees to be paid for applications, examination, reexamination, licensing and renewal, reinstatement, and recordmaking and recordkeeping

sections.heading: (1)A person desiring to be licensed as a Florida certified public accountant shall apply to the department to take the licensure examination
sections.text: (2)A person applying to the department to take the licensure examination must create and maintain an online account with the department and provide an e-mail a

sections.heading: (1)A person desiring to be licensed as a Florida certified public accountant in this state shall apply to the department for licensure, and the department shall license any applicant who the board certifies is qualified to practice public accounting
